page.title: 03Curdridge Reading Room
page.content: The Reading Room in Curdridge is the same as a Village Hall except that it is owned and run by the village and not by the County Council. The Reading Room Management Committee are a group of people who live in Curdridge. Some represent the Parish Council, and others represent the users of the Reading Room - Fairlands School, the Drama Group, W.I., Curdridge Youth Group, Floral Club, Luncheon Club, Local History Society and the Friendship Club. Apart from the main committee there are three others, the House Committee, the Grounds Committee and the Entertainments Committee, which is responsible for raising money incase some major catastrophe happened, and the Reading Room Funds were not enough to pay for the damage. The Reading Room was built in 1884.
